attributes.name: description
attributes.content: China Railway Construction Corporation Limited (CRCC) is a prominent Beijing-based construction enterprise established in 2007 to publicize the assets of China Railway Construction. It ranks as the world's second-largest construction and engineering company by revenue as of 2014. CRCC operates under the oversight of the State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission of the State Council. Its A shares and H shares have been listed on the Shanghai and Hong Kong stock exchanges since February 2008.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: For 75 years, SMEC has built a reputation as a trusted partner on major transport and energy infrastructure projects around the world. Our design leaders and specialist teams draw on deep expertise and experience delivering projects across a range of diverse environments, from some of the worldâs most remote locations to some of the densest urban surroundings.

body.value:
For 75 years, SMEC has built a reputation as a trusted partner on major transport and energy infrastructure projects around the world. Our design leaders and specialist teams draw on deep expertise and experience delivering projects across a range of diverse environments, from some of the worldâs most remote locations to some of the densest urban surroundings.

We understand the value of relationships to ensure that we comprehensively address all requirements at each stage in a projectâs development. By closely collaborating with our clients, contractors, subcontractors and asset operators, we deliver commercially informed design thinking through local specialists who understand on-the-ground context and industry expectations.

As a member of the Surbana Jurong Group, SMEC is part of a family of specialists. Collaborating closely with our parent and sister companies, we have the flexibility to operate in global markets either individually or in partnership to add value.

Since its formation, Singapore headquartered Surbana Jurong Group has invested in deepening its expertise in architecture, design, engineering, facilities management and security services, building a global group of specialist consulting and advisory firms. With size and scale becoming increasingly important for companies to effectively compete in larger urbanisation and infrastructure projects, SMEC can draw on capabilities from a group of highly specialised consultancies to provide a full service offering to clients around the world based on years of global experience.

We continue to create synergies across the Surbana Jurong Group of companies and foster innovation to drive value for our clients. This allows us to compete in larger and more complex projects, and provide our clients with specialist expertise.

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Zimbabwe Electricity Transmission & Distribution Company (ZETDC) is a subsidiary of ZESA Holdings, responsible for the transmission and distribution of electricity within Zimbabwe. ZETDC plays a critical role in ensuring the reliable and efficient delivery of electricity to homes, businesses, and industries across the nation.

body.value:
The Zimbabwe Electricity Transmission & Distribution Company (ZETDC) is a subsidiary of ZESA Holdings, responsible for the transmission and distribution of electricity within Zimbabwe. ZETDC plays a critical role in ensuring the reliable and efficient delivery of electricity to homes, businesses, and industries across the nation.

With a commitment to providing quality service, ZETDC manages and maintains the national power grid, ensuring the stability and safety of electricity supply. The company works to enhance the country's electricity infrastructure, support economic growth, and meet the energy needs of its customers. Through continuous innovation and strategic investments, ZETDC aims to improve service delivery, minimize outages, and promote sustainable energy use in Zimbabwe.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Seed Capital Assistance Facility (SCAF) is a public sector donorâfunded facility designed to support private sector fund managers, platform managers and development companies active in the low-carbon sector in high-risk frontier markets in Southeast Asia and Sub-Saharan Africa.

body.value:
The Seed Capital Assistance Facility (SCAF) is a public sector donorâfunded facility designed to support private sector fund managers, platform managers and development companies active in the low-carbon sector in high-risk frontier markets in Southeast Asia and Sub-Saharan Africa.

One of the primary challenges slowing the deployment of renewable energy assets in frontier markets is the early-stage financing gap. While the costs of early-stage development are comparatively low, the risks and barriers for investors and developers are extremely high, dynamic, and constantly changingâespecially in frontier markets.

SCAF uses a combination of pure and repayable grants to enable private sector fund managers, platform managers and development companies to setâup climate investment vehicles, build enterprise and local expertise, create strong project pipelines, and fully develop the most promising projects into highâquality, bankable investment opportunities that attract additional financing, achieve financial close, and move on to construction and operation. The resulting outcomes include emissions reductions, clean energy production, energy access, job creation, and revenue generation.

Managed by

Frankfurt School
of Finance & Management gGmbH
Adickesallee 32-34
60322 Frankfurt am Main, Germany

A facility of the
United Nations Environment Programme

 

(Source: Organisation)

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Shumba Energy, a Botswana-based, locally owned coal and energy development company, is listed on both the Botswana Stock Exchange (BSE) and the Stock Exchange of Mauritius (SEM). Their strategic advantages include operating in a country with the best credit rating in sub-Saharan Africa, along with a stable fiscal and political environment. As a major industry player, Shumba Energy is diligently pursuing its development objectives. Their short-term mission involves advancing into production to create cash flow and deliver returns to shareholders.

body.value: Shumba Energy, a Botswana-based, locally owned coal and energy development company, is listed on both the Botswana Stock Exchange (BSE) and the Stock Exchange of Mauritius (SEM). Their strategic advantages include operating in a country with the best credit rating in sub-Saharan Africa, along with a stable fiscal and political environment. As a major industry player, Shumba Energy is diligently pursuing its development objectives. Their short-term mission involves advancing into production to create cash flow and deliver returns to shareholders. However, their overarching goal is to address chronic power shortages in the Southern African Development Community (SADC) region. By doing so, they aim to power the future sustainably and cost-effectively.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Intensive Energy User Group (IEUG) is a Private Voluntary Organization (PVO) for Zimbabwean companies consuming a baseload requirement of at least one megawatt of power during daily activities to solve the looming crisis in electrical energy supplies that is threatening the growth prospects of the whole region as we advance. To this end, the IEUG has negotiated with the Zimbabwean authorities to conduct independent negotiations with regional and domestic power producers and to import power via the regional system through ZESA Holdings infrastructure.

body.value:
Intensive Energy User Group (IEUG) is a Private Voluntary Organization (PVO) for Zimbabwean companies consuming a baseload requirement of at least one megawatt of power during daily activities to solve the looming crisis in electrical energy supplies that is threatening the growth prospects of the whole region as we advance. To this end, the IEUG has negotiated with the Zimbabwean authorities to conduct independent negotiations with regional and domestic power producers and to import power via the regional system through ZESA Holdings infrastructure.

The establishment of the IEUG in Zimbabwe is seen as a real game changer, it allows the private sector to procure reliable, secure, predictable, and uninterruptable power at competitive prices. It also brings the financial capacity of the private sector in support of energy investment to meet the need to fund the many billions of dollars that have to be invested in the energy sector to meet current and future demand. This in no way diminishes the role of the public utilities in the region, it rather strengthens the system and enables the utilities to optimize their own operations. The IEUG represents the transformation of the electricity supply industry by the participation of the private sector.

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.content: Rosa Grains is a UAE-based grain trading and logistics company specializing in sourcing grains and oilseeds directly from producers worldwide. The company offers comprehensive services, including risk management, storage solutions across various locations, and global ocean freight services. Rosa Grains is committed to delivering high-quality products at fair prices, aiming to build long-term relationships with clients by meeting their specific requirements and adhering to global trading standards.Â

body.value:
Rosa Grains is a UAE-based grain trading and logistics company specializing in sourcing grains and oilseeds directly from producers worldwide. The company offers comprehensive services, including risk management, storage solutions across various locations, and global ocean freight services. Rosa Grains is committed to delivering high-quality products at fair prices, aiming to build long-term relationships with clients by meeting their specific requirements and adhering to global trading standards. 

In partnership with Egypt's Roots Commodities, Rosa Grains is a key developer and future operator of the East Port Said Grain Terminal. This strategic infrastructure project aims to enhance Egypt's grain import and handling capabilities, contributing significantly to the country's food security and trade efficiency.

attributes.content: Roots Commodities is a leading Egyptian trading house specializing in grains and pulses. Established in 2012 in Cairo, the company has expanded its operations to include logistics and industrial processing in both Egypt and the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) regions. With an annual trading volume exceeding one million tons, Roots Commodities has established a significant presence in the commodity trading sector.

body.value:
Roots Commodities is a leading Egyptian trading house specializing in grains and pulses. Established in 2012 in Cairo, the company has expanded its operations to include logistics and industrial processing in both Egypt and the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) regions. With an annual trading volume exceeding one million tons, Roots Commodities has established a significant presence in the commodity trading sector.

The company is also a key developer and future operator of the East Port Said Grain Terminal, a strategic infrastructure project aimed at enhancing Egypt's grain import and handling capabilities. This initiative is undertaken in partnership with Rosa Grains and the Suez Canal Economic Zone (SCZone) .

attributes.content: (Also known as Groupe Fondasol)For over 65 years, the Fondasol Group has been supporting construction and spatial development operators with the engineering challenges they face in their projects, whatever their scale and location.Steered by its founding 'musketeers' for 40 years, Fondasol quickly established itself as a badge of quality in geotechnical engineering, developing its operations nationwide and regularly taking on jobs abroad.

body.value:
(Also known as Groupe Fondasol)

For over 65 years, the Fondasol Group has been supporting construction and spatial development operators with the engineering challenges they face in their projects, whatever their scale and location.

Steered by its founding 'musketeers' for 40 years, Fondasol quickly established itself as a badge of quality in geotechnical engineering, developing its operations nationwide and regularly taking on jobs abroad.

Now, over 60 years since its creation, Fondasol is a Group with a presence on several continents, proposing global, concerted solutions.

Without ever losing sight of the importance of its technical acumen, Fondasol Group continues to perpetuates the pioneering spirit and courage of its founders as it accompanies the digital transformation of its sector ad pushes back the boundaries of its different expert fields.

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.content: The World Bank, part of the World Bank Group, provides essential financial and technical assistance to developing nations to combat poverty. It comprises two main institutions: the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD), which focuses on middle-income and creditworthy countries, and the International Development Association (IDA), which targets the poorest nations.

body.value: The World Bank, part of the World Bank Group, provides essential financial and technical assistance to developing nations to combat poverty. It comprises two main institutions: the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD), which focuses on middle-income and creditworthy countries, and the International Development Association (IDA), which targets the poorest nations. Supported by entities like the International Finance Corporation (IFC) and the Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency (MIGA), the World Bank offers low-interest loans, interest-free credits, and grants for initiatives in education, health, infrastructure, and environmental management. Together, they strive for inclusive and sustainable globalization, addressing both immediate and long-term developmental needs.

body.value:
ELICA GROUP, a member of the leading conglomerate Copelouzos Group, participates in the market of Renewable Energy Sources in Greece from a leading position. It is a joint venture (50% -50%) of Copelouzos Group and International Constructional Group. It has been active in the sector of Renewable Energy Sources since 1997, having extensive experience in the design, development, licensing, construction and operation of RES projects.

It is one of the leading Renewable Energy Groups in Greece having designed, developed, licensed and constructed a large number of wind, photovoltaic and hydroelectric power plants, with a total capacity of around 500 MW, which are in which are in operation today.

In addition, it has more than 2000 MW of Wind Farms in Greece, with an emphasis on the Aegean, in the mature licensing phase. Among them, it is worth highlighting the development of both a 1000 MW wind farm array on the island of Crete, which will thus become the largest green island in the world, and the offshore wind farm of Alexandroupoli-Thrace in Northern Greece, the first realistic project . of its kind thanks to the low depth of the sea.

Alongside. ELICA GROUP is developing a strategic project: the electrical interconnection of Egypt with Greece. The project is perfectly aligned with Europe's energy strategy towards the electrification of energy systems and their supply with clean green energy, with the aim of the rapid penetration of RES and its independence from fossil fuels.

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.content: The City of Tshwane Metropolitan Municipality, a Category A municipality in Gauteng Province, is the largest in South Africa, formed by merging with the Metsweding District. Pretoria, the capital, is home to the second-largest number of embassies globally and features the Union Buildings, which host important presidential inaugurations. The city has a rich heritage, highlighted by numerous museums, monuments, and vibrant arts markets. Key attractions include the Science and Technology Museum, the operational South African Mint, and luxurious township experiences.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Genser Energy is a diversified energy company, incorporated in the USA with operations in West Africa.We are the leading embedded power generation producer in Ghana with just over 200MW of installed capacity. Over the last 18 years, we have designed and built seven power plants in Ghana and one in Burkina Faso.We continue to operate five of these, providing power to Ghana's leading gold mines, transferring the others to customers.We distribute natural gas through our pipeline network of over 425km, selling power and natural gas to mines and industry.

body.value:
Genser Energy is a diversified energy company, incorporated in the USA with operations in West Africa.

We are the leading embedded power generation producer in Ghana with just over 200MW of installed capacity. Over the last 18 years, we have designed and built seven power plants in Ghana and one in Burkina Faso.

We continue to operate five of these, providing power to Ghana's leading gold mines, transferring the others to customers.

We distribute natural gas through our pipeline network of over 425km, selling power and natural gas to mines and industry.

We design, finance and build our power generation, gas distribution and gas midstream assets and are currently constructing a gas conditioning plant and cryogenic storage tank to enhance our gas midstream business.

 

(Source: Company)
body.processed:
Genser Energy is a diversified energy company, incorporated in the USA with operations in West Africa.

We are the leading embedded power generation producer in Ghana with just over 200MW of installed capacity. Over the last 18 years, we have designed and built seven power plants in Ghana and one in Burkina Faso.

We continue to operate five of these, providing power to Ghana's leading gold mines, transferring the others to customers.

We distribute natural gas through our pipeline network of over 425km, selling power and natural gas to mines and industry.

We design, finance and build our power generation, gas distribution and gas midstream assets and are currently constructing a gas conditioning plant and cryogenic storage tank to enhance our gas midstream business.

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.content: Mainstream Energy Solutions Limited (MESL) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Mainstream Energy Solutions Limited (MESL) was established in 2011 and licensed as a power-generating company. Through a concession agreement with the Federal Government of Nigeria, MESL acquired the Kainji and Jebba Hydro Plants (HPP) in November 2013, with a combined installed capacity of 1,338.4 MW. These two hydro plants are located 100 kilometers apart, with the Kainji dam positioned upstream of the Jebba plant.

body.value:
Mainstream Energy Solutions Limited (MESL) was established in 2011 and licensed as a power-generating company. Through a concession agreement with the Federal Government of Nigeria, MESL acquired the Kainji and Jebba Hydro Plants (HPP) in November 2013, with a combined installed capacity of 1,338.4 MW. These two hydro plants are located 100 kilometers apart, with the Kainji dam positioned upstream of the Jebba plant.

The Kainji and Jebba hydro power plants have installed capacities of 760 MW and 578.4 MW, respectively. Kainji was commissioned as Nigeriaâs first hydro power plant in 1968, while Jebba followed in 1985. These facilities are key components of Nigeriaâs energy infrastructure and play a critical role in the nationâs electricity supply.

At the time of acquisition in 2013, the plantsâ combined capacity was 482 MW, with Kainji non-operational. MESL has since restored their capacity to 1,002 MW, now contributing an average of 25% of Nigeriaâs electricity. The company is managed by a seasoned Board of Directors and Executive Management team.

 

(Source: Company)

body.value:
Russian Export Center JSC (REC) is a State-owned development institute established by the Government to support the development of the non-commodity exports industry/sector. REC offers a wide range of financial and non-financial support tools to benefit the Russian exporters explore the foreign markets and build capacity in the global trade. REC also acts as a focal point for interaction with the relevant domestic ministries and agencies and cooperates with key industries and business players in Russia to improve the export conditions in Russia and help bypass trade barriers.

REC was established by the Federal Law No. 185-FZ dated June 29, 2015 âOn Amendments to the Federal Law âOn the Bank for Developmentâ and Article 970 of Part 2 of the Civil Code of the Russian Federationâ.

The Russian Export Center Group incorporates the Russian Agency for Export Credit and Investment Insurance (EXIAR JSC) and Eximbank of Russia JSC aiming to offer comprehensive integrated services to the export-oriented companies.

 

(Source: Organisation)

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT OF NIGERIA (FGN) began to show interest in the establishment of an Iron and Steel Industry in the country as far back as 1958 â well before the advent of the oil boom period. Thus, having realized and accepted the importance of steel in the Technological Advancement of the Nation, the FGN by Decree No. 19 of April 1971, established the Nigeria Steel Development Authority (NSDA) to plan, operate and maintain Iron Ore Steel plants in the country as well as to carry out steel raw material surveys, suitability tests and mining operations.

body.value: THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT OF NIGERIA (FGN) began to show interest in the establishment of an Iron and Steel Industry in the country as far back as 1958 â well before the advent of the oil boom period. Thus, having realized and accepted the importance of steel in the Technological Advancement of the Nation, the FGN by Decree No. 19 of April 1971, established the Nigeria Steel Development Authority (NSDA) to plan, operate and maintain Iron Ore Steel plants in the country as well as to carry out steel raw material surveys, suitability tests and mining operations. In conjunction with Techno-Export (TPE) of USSR, the NSDA carried out geophysical and geological investigations on different Ore Sites. The most promising deposit was located at Itakpe Hill close to Okene in Kogi State. Detailed investigation established the reserves to be about 200 million tonnes with an approximate iron (Fe) grade of 36%. Decree No. 60 of 19th September, 1979 dissolved the NSDA and established six companies, one of which was Associated Ores Mining Company (AOMC). AOMC was later renamed National Iron Ore Mining Company (NIOMCO) in February 1987.

In conjunction with Techno-Export (TPE) of USSR, the NSDA carried out geophysical and geological investigations on different Ore Sites. The most promising deposit was located at Itakpe Hill close to Okene in Kogi State. Detailed investigation established the reserves to be about 200 million tonnes with an approximate iron (Fe) grade of 36%. Decree No. 60 of 19th September, 1979 dissolved the NSDA and established six companies, one of which was Associated Ores Mining Company (AOMC). AOMC was later renamed National Iron Ore Mining Company (NIOMCO) in February 1987.

attributes.content: JSC VO Tyazhpromexport cooperates with more than 30 countries in Europe, Asia, Africa and Latin America.JSC "VO "Tyazhpromexport" provides assistance to foreign countries in the design, construction, reconstruction and operation of ferrous and non-ferrous metallurgy enterprises, mining and coal industries, machine-building plants both on a technical assistance basis and on a turnkey basis.

body.value:
JSC VO Tyazhpromexport cooperates with more than 30 countries in Europe, Asia, Africa and Latin America.

JSC "VO "Tyazhpromexport" provides assistance to foreign countries in the design, construction, reconstruction and operation of ferrous and non-ferrous metallurgy enterprises, mining and coal industries, machine-building plants both on a technical assistance basis and on a turnkey basis.

The association also specializes in the export and import of complete machines and equipment for ferrous and non-ferrous metallurgy enterprises, engineering enterprises, as well as for mining and coal industry facilities.

JSC VO Tyazhpromexport carries out orders with the involvement of survey, research and design institutes, construction and industrial organizations and enterprises of Russia.

When fulfilling orders, we provide high-performance equipment, guarantee its high performance characteristics, timely delivery of spare parts and necessary technical documentation. At the customer's request, the equipment can be manufactured in a special design that ensures operation in dry or humid tropical climates.

 

(Source: Company)

body.value:
The ILF Group is an international engineering and consulting firm that helps its clients successfully execute technically demanding industrial and infrastructure projects. With 2,500 highly qualified employees at more than 40 office locations across five continents, the companies of the ILF Group have a strong regional presence.

This enables ILF to interact with clients and project parties on site. At the same time, close cooperation within the network of the ILF Group makes it possible to draw on international experts and make use of their special experience, processes, and tools.

The combination of local presence and international expertise ensures that client needs are met in the best possible way. The company is privately owned by the founding families and is therefore completely independent. It has no affiliation with manufacturers, suppliers, or financial institutions.

Founded in 2018, the company is presently focused on the Serowa Gas Project and various solar energy initiatives within the country. body.value:
Botala Energy is committed to advancing a secure, sustainable, and prosperous energy future for Botswana while unlocking new economic opportunities. Founded in 2018, the company is presently focused on the Serowa Gas Project and various solar energy initiatives within the country. Botala Energy aims to achieve zero-net-carbon emissions by developing hybrid energy projects in the region.

Currently, the company's operations are centered around coal bed methane (CBM) projects, with plans to explore additional renewable energy opportunities. Botala Energy's development efforts are designed to deliver significant social, environmental, and economic benefits to a wide range of stakeholders and shareholders. These benefits include improving the reliability and supply of Botswana's energy, reducing domestic electricity costs, decreasing reliance on imported energy, and creating revenue through the export of cleaner electricity and gas.
